text: Alex J. Meunier (November 9, 1897 – November 8, 1983) was a Republican member of the Wisconsin Senate, representing the 1st District from 1963 to 1971.Wisconsin Blue Book, 1966 edition, Members of the Senate, page 21. Meunier attended the Algoma Teachers College, and taught in Door County schools for nine years. He also served in the Army, and operated his own orchard. He was a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1943, and 1949. He died at a hospital in 1983."Ex-legislator Alex Meunier dies", Madison Wisconsin State Journal, Thursday, November 10, 1983, Madison, Wisconsin, United States. ==References== Category:1897 births Category:1983 deaths Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:People from Door County, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Alex Meunier
